thread.section_title: Police search as third person in two days jumps off Westminster Bridge – Metro
thread.title: Police search as third person in two days jumps off Westminster Bridge
thread.title_full: Police search as third person in two days jumps off Westminster Bridge

author: tmeyjes
title: Police search as third person in two days jumps off Westminster Bridge
text:
The man is the third person in two days to jump off the bridge (Picture: In Pictures Ltd./Corbis via Getty Images) Police have launched a rescue operation after the third person in two days jumped off Westminster Bridge just over a week since the terror attack. 
A search is still ongoing for the man, who entered the water around 7pm, the bridge was closed but has now been reopened.
Five victims of helicopter crash in Snowdonia 'were from same family' Metropolitan Police are using boats to search the Thames but are yet to locate the man.
It comes just over a day after a man and a woman jumped into the Thames from the bridge as London marked a week since the terror attack that killed four innocent people and injured 40.
The man was not recovered following a search but the woman was rescued and taken to hospital.
Police are dealing with a male who has entered the water from Westminster Bridge. @MPSonthewater are working to trace and rescue this male
— Westminster Police (@MPSWestminster) March 30, 2017 

Yesterday’s jumps came just before a march over the bridge to show solidarity with the victims.
Kurt Cochran, 54, Leslie Rhodes, 75, and Aysha Frade, 44, were all killed on the birdge as Khalid Masood aimed his car at pedestrians before stabbing PC Keith Palmer, 48, to death.
MORE: Five victims of helicopter crash in Snowdonia ‘were from same family’ 
MORE: Nicola Sturgeon writes letter requesting Scottish referendum
